attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Tom Baker has been one of the country's best loved actors over the last 40 years. Tom Baker is perhaps best known for his role of Doctor Who (1974-81) for which he often considered to be the best. He was nominated for two Golden Globe Awards for his role as Rasputin in the 1971 film Nicholas and Alexandra. Tom also also starred as Sherlock Holmes, the ITV series 'Medics', the BBc television series 'Randall and Hopkirk' and in more recent years has been the voice of the BBCs 'Little Britain'. 

We request Tom Baker is honoured for his services to acting and the enjoyment he has brought to the viewing public.

rejection.details: The Cabinet Office is actively seeking nominations for honours from the public. Please go to http://www.honours.gov.uk/
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
